description.value:
Totem of Raven

Totem Spirit (Cunning) — Creation Cost: 6 Gnosis

Spirit Aspect: Secrets / Omens / Passage

Recommended Umbra Spirits (CR 8+)

To bind Raven, the pack must confront a spirit of secrets, memory, and the thin boundary between life and death. Suitable spirits include:

  • Elder Carrion-Seer Spirit (Raven Aspect) — Suggested base: Spirit-empowered necromancer or omen-beast (CR 9–11), reflavored as a pure Umbra oracle rather than undead
  • Watcher of the Last Breath — Suggested base: Wraith-like or specter-adjacent stat block (CR 8–10), stripped of undead typing and treated as a spirit of transition
  • Omen-Flock Spirit — Suggested base: Single-entity swarm intelligence (CR 8–9), focused on divination, illusion, and battlefield awareness

These spirits prefer bargains, secrets, and revelations. Violence is possible, but insight or sacrifice is more respected.

Individual Trait

The creature who touches the Totem gains the following benefit until the next long rest:

  • You gain advantage on Wisdom (Insight) and Intelligence (Investigation) checks
  • Once per long rest, when you fail a Gnosis Roll, you may treat the result as if you had rolled a 10 on the die

Only one creature may benefit from this trait at a time.

Pack Trait

As an action, a creature touching the Totem may invoke Raven's omens.

For 1 minute, while within 30 feet of the Totem:

  • Pack members gain advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) and Charisma (Deception) checks
  • Once during the duration, when a pack member would be surprised, they are not surprised and may immediately move up to 10 feet without provoking opportunity attacks
  • This movement must end in cover or concealment if possible.

Ban — Keep the Secret

Raven demands discretion and respect for hidden truths.

The pack must not reveal secrets, omens, or knowledge entrusted to them unless doing so is reasonably necessary to prevent grave harm.

If the pack carelessly exposes secrets, betrays confidences, or reveals information for convenience or pride, the Totem becomes dormant and all its benefits cease.

To restore the Totem, the pack leader must reinvest the required Gnosis cost to reaffirm the bond.

If the pack repeatedly or egregiously violates this Ban, Raven may withdraw entirely, permanently severing itself from the Totem at the Storyteller's discretion.

Totem rules: Only one Totem per pack; benefits do not stack; a dormant Totem provides no benefits. Once a Totem benefit is used, it cannot be used again until after a long rest. Interacting with a Totem requires 1 action while touching it; choose either the Individual Trait or the Pack Trait.
